alert.note: Alert for Butler; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Escambia; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 4:07AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Butler, central Monroe, southwestern Crenshaw, east central Clarke, northern Escambia, Conecuh and northern Covington Counties through 445 AM CDT... At 406 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Greenville to Peterman to 8 miles east of Whatley. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Andalusia, Greenville, Monroeville, Brewton, Evergreen, Frisco City, McCullough, Peterman, Georgiana, Uriah, McKenzie, River Falls, Castleberry, Excel, Red Level, Dozier, Repton, Heath, Gantt and I65 And US 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Escambia; Monroe
